result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio T Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio T Martinez in court.  Attorney Jade Hall in court for Antonio T Martinez on behalf of Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski.

Case in court for a plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court grants adjournment and schedules the matter for plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 10-05-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Antonio T Martinez in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for Amanda Kirklewski for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel has received discovery and will receive an offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea hearing in Branch 2.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio T Martinez in court, appear by video with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case 01CF765.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Parks.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio T Martinez in court, appear by video with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present. State needs more time for witness to be present.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CEL (d.o.b. 11/25/89)
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Antonio T Martinez in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Antonio T Martinez in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio T Martinez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
